answers.answer: Children with disabilities need more material and psychological resources during times of war and emergencies.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/taking-care-of-children-with-disabilities and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Families can prepare by getting ready an emergency suitcase with necessary items and by preparing children, especially those with autism spectrum disorders, for situations like explosions and bomb shelters.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/taking-care-of-children-with-disabilities and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: An emergency suitcase should contain a strategic first aid kit with medicines, special food, hygiene products for toilet difficulties, and special equipment like wheelchairs if possible.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/taking-care-of-children-with-disabilities and read the section under 'An emergency suitcase for a child with a disability should contain a number of other things, in addition to the basics:'.

answers.answer: Enough special food should be packed to have a reserve, especially if the child has a special diet or eating disorder.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/taking-care-of-children-with-disabilities and read the section under 'An emergency suitcase for a child with a disability should contain a number of other things, in addition to the basics:'.

answers.answer: Crucial hygiene products for children with toilet difficulties include diapers, disposable diapers, and remedies for bedsores and intertrigo.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/taking-care-of-children-with-disabilities and read the section under 'An emergency suitcase for a child with a disability should contain a number of other things, in addition to the basics:'.

answers.answer: Special equipment like special beds, stretchers, and wheelchairs can help children with disabilities during evacuation, if required and possible.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/taking-care-of-children-with-disabilities and read the section under 'An emergency suitcase for a child with a disability should contain a number of other things, in addition to the basics:'.

answers.answer: Medicines, especially those the child needs regularly, should be packed as part of a strategic first aid kit for 3-4 weeks.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/taking-care-of-children-with-disabilities and read the section under 'An emergency suitcase for a child with a disability should contain a number of other things, in addition to the basics:'.

answers.answer: Children with autism can be prepared by building a 'hut' for practicing taking cover, using headphones, and by adults remaining calm and following daily routines.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/taking-care-of-children-with-disabilities and read the section under 'Children with autism spectrum disorders and/or mental disorders should be prepared in advance for situations when explosions are heard or when they have to go down to bomb shelters'.

answers.answer: Using headphones for sensitive children or teaching them to use headphones helps children with autism cope with emergency sounds.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/taking-care-of-children-with-disabilities and read the section under 'Children with autism spectrum disorders and/or mental disorders should be prepared in advance for situations when explosions are heard or when they have to go down to bomb shelters'.

answers.answer: Adult behavior significantly impacts children with autism, as they react strongly to the mood, behavior, and words of adults; therefore, adults must remain calm, confident, and avoid excessive emotions.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/taking-care-of-children-with-disabilities and read the section under 'Children with autism spectrum disorders and/or mental disorders should be prepared in advance for situations when explosions are heard or when they have to go down to bomb shelters'.

answers.answer: Daily routine is maintained for children with autism by continuing usual activities like cooking, cleaning, and reading books when there is no need to go to the bomb shelter.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/taking-care-of-children-with-disabilities and read the section under 'Children with autism spectrum disorders and/or mental disorders should be prepared in advance for situations when explosions are heard or when they have to go down to bomb shelters'.
